What I found is a survey result from Accenture, in a report called Dynamic Digital Consumers. Between October and November 2016, Accenture did a questionnaire survey with approximately 26,000 consumers in 26 countries. The survey found that only 4 percent of respondents own a voice-enabled digital assistant. While that seems like a very small portion of the population, two-thirds (65 percent) of owners said they use the device regularly.
